data.title: Barbara (Steele) Baker (1640-1710)

data.text:
Born 1640 [location unknown]

Daughter of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Profile last modified 10 Jun 2024

This page has been accessed 26 times.

Biography

Elizabeth Steele was born in 1740, according to her memorial inscription. [1] She was the wife of Daniel Baker, merchant of London, whom she married on 3 May 1657 at St Vedast Foster Lane, London. [2] Their marriage had three children: a son Daniel, who became High Sheriff of Buckinghamshire in 1721, and two daughters, the younger, Sarah, becaming the wife of Narcissus Luttrell, and the younger, Elizabeth, becoming the wife of Sir John Verney Bt.

Barbara Baker died in 1710 at London and was buried with her husband at Penn, Buckinghamshire. [1]

Her Will, dated 31 July 1701 and proved 25 August 1710 [3] named her son Daniel Baker, executor, and his children: Daniel, Samuel, John, James, Ann, Elizabeth, Sarah, Martha, Barbara; her daughters - Sarah Luttrell and her husband Narcissus Luttrell Esq, and their son Francis Luttrell; Elizabeth Verney and her husband Sir John Verney Bt. In a codicil of 20 January 1701/2, she added the stipulation that her daughters must deliver signed receipts for their bequests to her executor.

Sources

↑ 1.0 1.1 History, Monuments and Memorials of Holy Trinity, Penn, Buckinghamshire Penn

↑ Ancestry Marriage Index Ancestry UK

↑ Will of Barbarah Baker, Widow of London PROB 11/516/429
